newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland clears AIB to up WBK stake.
newsitem.headline: Poland clears AIB to up WBK stake.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland (NBP), the central bank, has cleared a subsidiary of Allied Irish Banks Plc (AIB) to up its stake in Wielkopolski Bank Kredytowy (WBK) to 60.2 percent, WBK said in a statement.
The subsidiary, AIB European Investments Ltd, currently has 36.3 percent of WBK.
The Friday statement said the central bank's decision would lose effect if AIB did not buy its shares by March 31, 1998.

AIB has said it wants to raise its 36.3 percent stake of WBK to a majority within three years from February 1997 by buying up to 23.9 percent of WBK currently held by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD).
The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) cleared the prospective stake increase last month after consulting with the anti-monopoly office.
